playgroundExamples.title: Basic File Upload Variants
playgroundExamples.description: Demonstrates both button and drag-drop variants with different configurations
playgroundExamples.code:
<GoabBlock gap="xl" mb="xl" direction="column">
  <GoabFormItem label="Button Variant Upload">
    <GoabFileUploadInput
      variant="button"
      maxFileSize="100MB"
      accept=".pdf,.doc,.docx"
      onSelectFile={(event) => {
        console.log('File selected:', event.file.name);
        alert(`Selected: ${event.file.name} (${event.file.size} bytes)`);
      }}
    />
  </GoabFormItem>

  <GoabFormItem label="Drag & Drop Upload">
    <GoabFileUploadInput
      variant="dragdrop"
      maxFileSize="100MB"
      accept="image/*"
      onSelectFile={(event) => {
        console.log('File selected:', event.file.name);
        alert(`Selected: ${event.file.name} (${event.file.size} bytes)`);
      }}
    />
  </GoabFormItem>
</GoabBlock>
usageNotes: Button variant is more compact and accessible
Drag-drop variant provides better user experience for larger upload areas
File type restrictions are enforced by the browser's file picker
maxFileSize is for display purposes - implement actual validation in onSelectFile

whenToUse: Users need to upload documents, images, or other files
File attachment is required for form completion
Multiple files need to be uploaded in sequence
Progress feedback is important for large files
whenNotToUse: For simple text input - use Input or TextArea instead
For selecting from predefined options - use Dropdown or Radio buttons
For immediate file processing without upload - consider alternative approaches
bestPractices: Always provide clear file type and size restrictions
Use dragdrop variant for primary upload areas
Use button variant when space is limited or for better accessibility
Provide immediate feedback on file selection and validation
Show progress for uploads that take longer than 2-3 seconds
Include error handling and clear error messages
Allow users to remove files before and after upload
contentGuidelines: Use clear, action-oriented instructions (e.g., 'Drag and drop your file here')
Specify accepted file types and size limits clearly
Provide helpful context about what the file will be used for
Use concise error messages that explain how to fix the problem

keyboardNavigation: Tab - Navigate to file input button
screenReader: File input announced with purpose and restrictions
Upload progress announced via live regions
File names and sizes announced when selected
focusManagement: Focus returns to upload area after file selection
Clear focus indicators on all interactive elements
Logical tab order through upload cards

common.solution: FileUpload components only handle UI - implement actual upload logic in your onSelectFile handler using your preferred upload service
Use button variant as fallback, ensure drag events are properly handled, check browser support
Implement actual file size validation in your onSelectFile handler: if (file.size > maxSizeInBytes) { showError(); return; }
Ensure progress prop is updated during upload process, use state management to track progress for each file

common.cause: Insufficient state management for multiple uploads
common.solution: Use unique IDs for each upload, maintain separate progress tracking for each file

integration.issue: FormItem validation not working with file uploads
integration.cause: File validation handled separately from form validation
integration.solution: Integrate file upload state with your form validation library, validate files in form submission handler

integration.cause: Missing required props or incorrect progress values
integration.solution: Ensure filename is provided, progress is between 0-100, check for required File object properties

commonMistakes.why: Components only provide UI - no upload implementation included
commonMistakes.instead: Implement upload logic in onSelectFile handler using your preferred upload service

commonMistakes.why: maxFileSize is for display/UI feedback only, not enforcement
commonMistakes.instead: Validate file size in your onSelectFile handler

commonMistakes.why: Components don't manage upload state internally
commonMistakes.instead: Use React state to track uploads and progress

commonMistakes.why: Progress cards won't show upload status without progress updates
commonMistakes.instead: Update progress prop during upload process
